Detailed Description

This class is used to represent a triangle in the collision scene.

Member Function Documentation

void WorldTriangle::bounce ( Vector3 &  v,
float  elasticity = 1.f 
) const

This method bounces the input vector off a plane parallel to this triangle.

Parameters:
v The vector to be bounced. This is passed by reference and obtains the result.
elasticity The elasticity of the bounce. 0 indicates that the resulting vector has no component in the direction of the plane's normal. 1 indicates that the the component in the direction of the plane's normal is reversed.

This method sets the flags associated with this triangle.

WorldTriangle::Flags WorldTriangle::flags (  )  const

This method returns the flags associated with this triangle.

bool WorldTriangle::intersects ( const WorldTriangle &  triangle,
const Vector3 &  offset 
) const

This method returns whether a triangular prism intersects this triangle.

The prism is described by a triangle and an offset.

Parameters:
triangle The triangle to test against, assumed to be in the same space as this triangle.
offset The offset of end triangle in volume.

bool WorldTriangle::intersects ( const Vector3 &  start,
const Vector3 &  dir,
float &  length 
) const

This method tests whether the input interval intersects this triangle.

The interval is from start to (start + length * dir). If it intersects, the input float is set to the value such that (start + length * dir) is the intersection point.

bool WorldTriangle::intersects ( const WorldTriangle &  triangle  )  const

This method returns whether the input triangle intersects this triangle.

This method returns whether or not this triangle uses blended transparency.

int  materialKind 
) [static]

This method packs collision flags + materialKind into a Flags type.

Vector2 WorldTriangle::project ( const Vector3 &  onTri  )  const

This method project the given 3D point to the basis defined by the sides of this triangle.

(0,0) is at v0, (1,0) is at v1, (0,1) is at v2, etc.

Currently it only uses a vertical projection.

const Vector3 & WorldTriangle::v ( uint32  index  )  const

This method returns vertex at given index.
